meanings.definition: A person who is regarded as despicable or contemptible.
meanings.sent1: That rotter stole my lunch money!
meanings.sent2: The town gossip is known as a rotter.
meanings.sent3: The rotter tried to blame the missing cookies on the dog!
meanings.sent4: His deceitful actions revealed him to be a true rotter.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the rotter lurking in the shadows.

meanings.sent1: Leaves left on the ground will rotter over time.
meanings.sent2: If you leave food out, it will rotter quickly.
meanings.sent3: The fruit began to rotter after being forgotten in the fridge.
meanings.sent4: Neglecting maintenance causes things to slowly rotter away.
meanings.sent5: The old house started to rotter from neglect.
